overview: This subject comprises clinical learning (general dentistry) in the Melbourne Dental Clinic (MDC), the Royal Dental Hospital of Melbourne, urban community health centres, specialist practice/hospital clinics and rural community health clinics. Students will engage in tasks that will demonstrate and further enhance their skills preparing them for the work environment in which they will participate and contribute to, on graduation as a dentist.

This year-long subject is developed as a capstone experience with a practice based learning approach. The learning tasks will enhance students’ capacity to apply theoretical knowledge gained in previous years of the course to “real world” situations. Students will integrate graduate capabilities with clinical skills that are required to practice as an independent health care professional. They will also develop skills in teamwork and communication with the wider health sector. The clinical practice sessions, especially at the community health centres, will allow students to reflect on emotional and practical issues of transition from the university learning environment to the world of independent clinical practice. They also provide the opportunity to link students to future employers. The intended learning outcomes are designed to engender the development of graduate attributes.

additional pre-requisite: Successful completion of all 3rd year DDS subjects

assessments.description: 1 x case-based short answer written examination (2000 word count equivalence). 2 hours
Rural Placement Presentation and Report. 1000 words (equivalent)
assessments.timing: At the end of the rural rotation

assessments.description: Oral Exam (Viva Voce)- of an unknown patient (3000 word count equivalence). 30 minutes
assessments.timing: End of the first half of year teaching period

assessments.description: Case presentation of a known patient (4000 word count equivalence). 30 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. Must pass this assessment in order to pass the subject - reassessment is available for this assessment

Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE)  3 - 4 Hours of assessment (4000 word count equivalence). 3-4 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Must pass this assessment to pass the subject - reassessment is available for this item of assessment
assessments.timing: During the second half of the year

assessments.description: Completion of an evidence-based dentistry written assignment (Pass/fail). 1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Must pass this assessment in order to pass the subject
assessments.timing: During the second half of the year

assessments.description: Portfolio of ongoing patient care (Pass/Fail). 20000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Must pass this assessment in order to pass the subject
Multi-source feedback (Pass/Fail). 4000 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Must pass this assessment in order to pass the subject.
Satisfactory Professional Behaviour (Pass/Fail). Hurdle requirement:. Satisfactory Professional Behaviour

Attendance at all Back-to-Base sessions & Clinical Placements (including hospital rotations, On-Call, Emergency Service & Field visits) (Pass/Fail). Hurdle requirement:. Attendance at all Back-to-Base sessions & Clinical Placements (including hospital rotations, On-Call, Emergency Service & Field visits)

Year Long.Principal coordinators: Denise Bailey Addison and Mathew Lim

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
